data.title: Cargo (un)loading should be fixed
data.body:
It should have:
- A small delay before the unload begins
- Playback of the opening anim
- Small delays between units disembarking
- Repeated playback of the opened anim
- Playback of the opening anim in reverse
- A small delay following the unload
- Similar as above for loading
- Units going to a sane rally point, preferring the cell directly below the transport unit in most cases

data.title: Add a method for writing notification text
data.body: Currently, information such as change of stance is output inside the chat area with the "Debug: " prefix. As this text output is useful for aiding the user in stateful and context sensitive situations, it should be given a dedicated write method and screen space outside of the chat area. Being the output of stateful commands, many lines of previous output are not needed; around three would be sufficient for identifying setting changes.

data.title: Add minimise button to build queues
data.body:
Currently, clicking the tab icon of a build queue that is currently selected minimises the build queue. This behaviour is often activated unintentionally, particularly by new users in a panic, costing them several critical seconds. A dedicated minimise/restore button (►/◄) at the top or bottom of the list of tab icons would aleviate this.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1401277-add-minimise-button-to-build-queues?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Replace string terrain types with MovementClasses.
data.body:
#3474 introduced a bitfield for efficiently representing the movement capabilities of an actor. This idea should be generalized for all terrain-type lookups by translating the string names (e.g. "clear", "water") to a uint (e.g. `1 << 0`,  `1 << 1`) when parsing the tileset and actor rules.

The thousands of string comparison tests that the pathfinder performs each query would become bitwise comparisons, which should give a significant performance improvement to pathfinding.

data.title: Investigate compressed orders.
data.body:
Ordering large groups of actors sends a spike of mostly duplicated data across the network. Compressing the frame orders with sharpziplib could potentially quite significantly reduce the data size, and therefore reduce network janks.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1401263-investigate-compressed-orders?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Split SyncInfo order into smaller chunks.
data.body:
It currently serializes the entire LobbyInfo. This should be changed to individual orders for Slot, GlobalSettings, Client, and ClientPing.

This would fix excessive lobby data in replays, #4282, and lay the groundwork for #4577 / #2281.

data.title: Ore miner unable to target ore
data.body: In RA mod, when building ore miners in a war factory, these miners are unable to be told to collect ore or gems. When hovering over ore (inside or outside of fog of war) with the miner selected, the move cursor is shown. Attempting force fire has no effect. When a second ore refinery is built, the miners are then able to be used as normal. Other units function as expected.

data.title: Cleaned up RPM macros, description, dependencies
data.body:
- bring back FreeType2
- also require SDL2
- don't depend on -devel packages
- assigned packaging reponsibilities to myself

data.title: multiplayer game state freezes after some time
data.body:
I'd suspect this problem to be known, but was not able to find the same bug report.

So:

Sometimes in multiplayer the game freezes. It looks like only the game state freezes. It's still possible to use the controls & everything.

I have the impression that the server game performance is very sensitive to the quality of connection of the player with the worst connection.
However, it's not like after a while one of the players times out and the game proceeds
The game easily hangs up for everyone then.
I also have the impression that players that disconnect or timeout are likely to freeze the game right after (or right before) everyone else gets the disconnect message of that player.

The bug affects everyone ingame.
I encounter it in almost every longer game and it affects every player in the game.

We are able to keep chatting (usually people start chatting then, to check if it's only them or everyone)

I use Debian 7.3, playing with release-20131223

data.title: More crate goodies?
data.body:
Why don't we have a larger variety of crate goodies? 

Lemme see if I can whip up a few ideas,

Positive effects:
- Spy Satellite: Select an area of the map to reveal and it stays revealed for 60 seconds.
- Double your power for XX seconds.
- Temporarily increased build speed.
-  Free random building of your side, no cost and pre-built.(shows up in the super-weapons area but you can only place it like any other building.) (Obviously we don't want people with 2 nuke silo's so that has to be taken into account.)

Negative effects:
- Reduce your power for XX seconds.
- Shuts down your base defenses for XX seconds.
- Teleports the unit that picked up the crate to a random spot on the map. 
- Lose $1000.

I literally just made these ideas up on the spot so feel free to dismiss them as stupid.

At least the testla tank can withstand some hits.

data.title: Playing against 'bots' painfully slow :(.
data.body:
Playing against 'bots' is painfully slow :(.

This has been a problem for a long while, the problem arises quickly on start of game, and soon becomes so slow it becomes ridiculously unbearable, and you just have to abort the game to save your sanity.

This is a shame, because 'bots' functionality as now become good enough to have a reasonable game, it's a shame that the slowness ruins the experience of a game against bots.

data.body: Im not sure if this is intentional but it would be great if flying units could attackmove,It would make shooting down units with yaks easier and shift command would make MIG's hit and runs alot easier.

data.title: very bad lag spikes due to pathfinding
data.body: After about 10 or 15 mins the game starts to freeze and play fine every few secs. I turned on the graph and the (white) pathingfind and (darkblue) Tick_time start spiking and eventually start going off my screen. none of my components are maxing. Was is the cause so i can turn it off or fix it. I have a intel i5 radeon 280x 16gb ram win 7 ult

data.title: Add range rings to the atom bomb
data.body:
Currently it is difficult for a player to tell the extent of the area around an atomic bomb attack which will be damaged by it. RA2:YR solved this by adding concentric rings, similar to the range circles when placing defensive structures, as seen [here](http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tb5HzWQkwVw/USc6t1ri6aI/AAAAAAAAFW8/Lt-AWUIwuzo/s1600/21_red-alert2-yuris-revenge.jpg).

As the OpenRA atomic bomb has a wider spread and gradual falloff to zero damage, the rings would be more useful if they aligned with damage thresholds, similar to those in [NukeMap](http://nuclearsecrecy.com/nukemap/) but without area colouring. For example, a ring could be displayed where the damage drops to 10% less than that of previous rings, or at the 99.7%, 95% and 68% intervals, or at the points where various different classes of unit or structure will be instantly destroyed.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1399589-add-range-rings-to-the-atom-bomb?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Multiplayer sync crash with dune 2000 Mod
data.body:
Multiplayer game crashed with an execption of 'System.InvalidOperationException'.
The game was a free for all with 2 players and 2 ai and crashed when the host player moved to defend a harverster under attack from an ai.

Exception.log:

```
Dune 2000 Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5472
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 3399: Blame Tick.
 Compare syncreport.log with other players.
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync(Int32 frame, String blame)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.CheckSync(Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.<TickImmediate>c__AnonStorey13.<>m__4(Int32 clientId, Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.<Receive>c__AnonStorey1B.<>m__12(Int32 client, Byte[] data)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey35.<>m__6A()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Differences in syncreport.log
Host harvester has more health:

```
566      75 harvester Tree Health (610)     566      75 harvester Tree Health (565) 
567          hp: 610    567          hp: 565 
```

Later down, only this part was on the hosts report:

```
4915         Missile (-1778974468)      
4916             pos: 68307,20839,0     
4917             facing: 199        
4918             targetPosition: 68303,20785,0      
4919             offset: 70,41,0        
4920             ticks: 30      
4921             SourceActor: bazooka 218       
4922             GuidedTarget: harvester 75
```

There were 2 more bullets afterwards on both sides.

Host syncreport:
http://pastebin.com/2qxZAHdB

Player 2 syncreport:
http://pastebin.com/Dh7D5uQd

data.title: "OpenRA.Game.exe has encountered a problem and needs to close.  We are sorry for the inconvenience."
data.body:
So, I installed the game.  I try to start it up and I get this error (in the title).

I have no idea what's wrong.  I'm using Windows XP SP3.  When I checked the Error Signature, I got this:

AppName: openra.game.exe
AppVer: 0.0.0.0
ModName: kernel32.dll
ModVer: 5.1.2600.5512

Any help would be appreciated.

Running Windows 8.1

data.title: Submarine torpedos can travel through ground when locked on to an enemy vessel
data.body: However it doesn't always happen - sometimes the torpedos will correctly explode upon hitting the beach. Other times you'll see the torpedo going across the grass/snow
